newsitem.title: UK: Nationwide conversion rebel makes u-turn.
newsitem.headline: Nationwide conversion rebel makes u-turn.

text.p: Britain's Nationwide Building Society looks set to win its battle to retain its mutual status after the man who led the campaign for its conversion to a bank changed his mind, the Guardian newspaper said on Friday.
The Guardian said Michael Hardern, who ran the Members for Conversion pressure group, had admitted he was wrong.

Many of Britain's building societies have taken advantage of new legislation to convert to bank status and float. Millions of its customers have benefited from substantial share windfalls in the process.
Nationwide has urged its members to vote against conversion, arguing it could better serve its customers with mutual status and could offer lower lending rates.
